NOTE: This calculation MAY NOT reflect the \u201cper-user\u201d price-per-share, and instead should reflect the \u201caverage-user\u2019s\u201d price-per-share, meaning what the average user should expect to see when exchanging to and from."},"convertToShares(uint256)":{"details":"Returns the amount of shares that the Vault would exchange for the amount of assets provided, in an ideal scenario where all the conditions are met. - MUST NOT be inclusive of any fees that are charged against assets in the Vault. - MUST NOT show any variations depending on the caller. - MUST NOT reflect slippage or other on-chain conditions, when performing the actual exchange. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: This calculation MAY NOT reflect the \u201cper-user\u201d price-per-share, and instead should reflect the \u201caverage-user\u2019s\u201d price-per-share, meaning what the average user should expect to see when exchanging to and from."},"deposit(uint256,address)":{"details":"Mints shares Vault shares to receiver by depositing exactly amount of underlying tokens. - MUST emit the Deposit event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the   deposit execution, and are accounted for during deposit. - MUST revert if all of assets cannot be deposited (due to deposit limit being reached, slippage, the user not   approving enough underlying tokens to the Vault contract, etc). NOTE: most implementations will require pre-approval of the Vault with the Vault\u2019s underlying asset token."},"eip712Domain()":{"details":"returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature."},"getBalanceOfAsset(address)":{"params":{"owner":"The address of the account whose asset balance is checked."}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have the admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"maxDeposit(address)":{"details":"Returns the maximum amount of the underlying asset that can be deposited into the Vault for the receiver, through a deposit call. - MUST return a limited value if receiver is subject to some deposit limit. - MUST return 2 ** 256 - 1 if there is no limit on the maximum amount of assets that may be deposited. - MUST NOT revert."},"maxMint(address)":{"details":"Returns the maximum amount of the Vault shares that can be minted for the receiver, through a mint call. - MUST return a limited value if receiver is subject to some mint limit. - MUST return 2 ** 256 - 1 if there is no limit on the maximum amount of shares that may be minted. - MUST NOT revert."},"maxRedeem(address)":{"details":"Returns the maximum amount of Vault shares that can be redeemed from the owner balance in the Vault, through a redeem call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST return balanceOf(owner) if owner is not subject to any withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert."},"maxWithdraw(address)":{"details":"Returns the maximum amount of the underlying asset that can be withdrawn from the owner balance in the Vault, through a withdraw call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert."},"mint(uint256,address)":{"details":"Mints exactly shares Vault shares to receiver by depositing amount of underlying tokens. - MUST emit the Deposit event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the mint   execution, and are accounted for during mint. - MUST revert if all of shares cannot be minted (due to deposit limit being reached, slippage, the user not   approving enough underlying tokens to the Vault contract, etc). Validate source and destination providers\n * 2. Check fee limits (max 20% of rebalanced amount)\n * 3. Withdraw assets from source provider\n * 4. Deposit assets to destination provider (minus fee)\n * 5. Transfer fee to treasury\n * 6. Optionally activate destination provider\n * 7. Emit rebalancing events\n *\n * @custom:usage Example:\n * ```solidity\n * // Rebalance 1000 USDC from Aave to Morpho with 1% fee\n * rebalancer.rebalance(\n *     1000e6, // 1000 USDC\n *     aaveProvider,\n *     morphoProvider,\n *     10e6, // 1% fee (10 USDC)\n *     true // Activate Morpho as active provider\n * );\n * ```\n */\ncontract Rebalancer is Vault {\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20Metadata;\n    using Math for uint256;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Errors\n     */\n    error Rebalancer__InvalidProvider();\n    error Rebalancer__ExcessRebalanceFee();\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initializes the Rebalancer contract with the specified parameters.\n     * @param asset_ The address of the underlying asset managed by the vault.\n     * @param name_ The name of the tokenized vault.\n     * @param symbol_ The symbol of the tokenized vault.\n     * @param providers_ An array of providers serving as a liquidity source for lending and/or yield.\n     * @param withdrawFeePercent_ The fee percentage applied to withdrawals.\n     * @param timelock_ The address of the timelock contract.\n     * @param treasury_ The address of the treasury.\n     */\n    constructor(\n        address asset_,\n        string memory name_,\n        string memory symbol_,\n        IProvider[] memory providers_,\n        uint256 withdrawFeePercent_,\n        address timelock_,\n        address treasury_\n    )\n        Vault(\n            asset_,\n            name_,\n            symbol_,\n            providers_,\n            withdrawFeePercent_,\n            timelock_,\n            treasury_\n        )\n    {}\n\n    receive() external payable {}\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IVault\n     */\n    function rebalance(\n        uint256 assets,\n        IProvider from,\n        IProvider to,\n        uint256 fee,\n        bool activateToProvider\n    ) external onlyOperator returns (bool) {\n        if (\n            !_validateProvider(address(from)) || !_validateProvider(address(to))\n        ) {\n            revert Rebalancer__InvalidProvider();\n        }\n\n        _checkFee(fee, assets);\n\n        _delegateActionToProvider(assets, \"withdraw\", from);\n        _delegateActionToProvider(assets - fee, \"deposit\", to);\n\n        if (fee > 0) {\n            address _treasury = treasury;\n\n            _asset.safeTransfer(_treasury, fee);\n            emit FeeCharged(_treasury, fee);\n        }\n\n        if (activateToProvider) {\n            _setActiveProvider(to);\n        }\n\n        emit RebalanceExecuted(\n            assets,\n            assets - fee,\n            address(from),\n            address(to)\n        );\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Validates that the rebalancing fee is within acceptable limits\n     * @param fee The fee amount to validate\n     * @param amount The total amount being rebalanced\n     *\n     * @dev The fee cannot exceed MAX_REBALANCE_FEE_PERCENT (20%) of the rebalanced amount\n     * @dev This prevents excessive fees that could harm users\n     * @dev Reverts with Rebalancer__ExcessRebalanceFee if fee is too high\n     */\n    function _checkFee(uint256 fee, uint256 amount) internal pure {\n        uint256 reasonableFee = amount.mulDiv(\n            MAX_REBALANCE_FEE_PERCENT,\n            PRECISION_FACTOR\n        );\n        if (fee > reasonableFee) {\n            revert Rebalancer__ExcessRebalanceFee();\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x0cab6c995914bbb7760fd6d9abf05c4d9e23c622603bc6e5dabc5dcd5411e86b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/access/AccessManager.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.23;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Context.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title AccessManager\n *\n * @dev Inspired and modified from OpenZeppelin's AccessControl contract.\n */\ncontract AccessManager is Context {\n    /**\n     * @dev Errors\n     */\n    error AccessManager__CallerIsNotAdmin();\n    error AccessManager__CallerIsNotOperator();\n    error AccessManager__CallerIsNotExecutor();\n\n    mapping(bytes32 role => mapping(address account => bool)) private _roles;\n\n    bytes32 public constant ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n    bytes32 public constant OPERATOR_ROLE = keccak256(\"OPERATOR_ROLE\");\n    bytes32 public constant EXECUTOR_ROLE = keccak256(\"EXECUTOR_ROLE\");\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when `account` is granted `role`.\n     */\n    event RoleGranted(\n        bytes32 indexed role,\n        address indexed account,\n        address indexed sender\n    );\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`.\n     */\n    event RoleRevoked(\n        bytes32 indexed role,\n        address indexed account,\n        address indexed sender\n    );\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has an admin role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessManager__CallerIsNotAdmin} error.\n     */\n    modifier onlyAdmin() {\n        if (!hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender())) {\n            revert AccessManager__CallerIsNotAdmin();\n        }\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has an operator role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessManager__CallerIsNotOperator} error.\n     */\n    modifier onlyOperator() {\n        if (!hasRole(OPERATOR_ROLE, _msgSender())) {\n            revert AccessManager__CallerIsNotOperator();\n        }\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has an executor role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessManager__CallerIsNotExecutor} error.\n     */\n    modifier onlyExecutor() {\n        if (!hasRole(EXECUTOR_ROLE, _msgSender())) {\n            revert AccessManager__CallerIsNotExecutor();\n        }\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Sets the deployer of the contract as the initial admin.\n     */\n    constructor() {\n        _grantRole(ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    ) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return _roles[role][account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have the admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleGranted} event.\n     */\n    function grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) public onlyAdmin {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have the admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) public onlyAdmin {\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Attempts to grant `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * Internal function without access restriction.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleGranted} event.\n     */\n    function _grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            _roles[role][account] = true;\n            emit RoleGranted(role, account, _msgSender());\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Attempts to revoke `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * Internal function without access restriction.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function _revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal {\n        if (hasRole(role, account)) {\n            _roles[role][account] = false;\n            emit RoleRevoked(role, account, _msgSender());\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xf242ffc21850c2c3980b157e93f9aeae59899cc64d84129f473a469a769b5fd3","license":"MIT"},"contracts/base/PausableActions.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.23;\n\nimport {Context} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Context.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title PausableActions\n * @notice Granular pausing mechanism for specific actions\n * @dev This contract provides fine-grained control over pausing specific actions\n *      rather than pausing the entire contract. It's inspired by OpenZeppelin's\n *      Pausable contract but allows for selective action pausing.\n * \n * @custom:features The contract supports:\n * - Individual action pausing (Deposit, Withdraw)\n * - Granular control over different operations\n * - Event emission for pause/unpause actions\n * - Modifier-based access control\n * \n * @custom:security Benefits:\n * - Prevents emergency situations from affecting all operations\n * - Allows selective disabling of problematic functions\n * - Maintains transparency through events\n * - Easy to extend with new action types\n * \n * @custom:usage Example:\n * ```solidity\n * contract MyVault is PausableActions {\n *     function deposit() external whenNotPaused(Actions.Deposit) {\n *         // Deposit logic\n *     }\n *     \n *     function withdraw() external whenNotPaused(Actions.Withdraw) {\n *         // Withdraw logic\n *     }\n *     \n *     function emergencyPauseDeposits() external onlyOwner {\n *         _pause(Actions.Deposit);\n *     }\n * }\n * ```\n */\nabstract contract PausableActions is Context {\n    /**\n     * @dev Errors\n     */\n    error PausableActions__ActionPaused();\n    error PausableActions__ActionNotPaused();\n\n    /// @notice Enumeration of pausable actions\n    /// @dev Each action can be paused independently\n    enum Actions {\n        Deposit,  /// @dev Pausing deposits prevents new funds from entering the vault\n        Withdraw  /// @dev Pausing withdrawals prevents users from exiting the vault\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Mapping of actions to their paused state\n    /// @dev true = paused, false = active\n    mapping(Actions => bool) private _actionPaused;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account` for a specific `action`.\n     */\n    event Paused(address account, Actions action);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account` for a specific `action`.\n     */\n    event Unpaused(address account, Actions action);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the specified `action` is not paused.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - The action must not be paused.\n     */\n    modifier whenNotPaused(Actions action) {\n        _requireNotPaused(action);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier to make a function _requirePaused(action);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the specified `action` is paused, and false otherwise.\n     */\n    function paused(Actions action) public view function _requirePaused(Actions action) internal view {\n        if (!paused(action)) {\n            revert PausableActions__ActionNotPaused();\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Triggers *\n     * - The action must be paused.\n     */\n    function _unpause(Actions action) internal whenPaused(action) {\n        _actionPaused[action] = false;\n        emit Unpaused(_msgSender(), solidity 0.8.23;\n\nimport {ERC20Permit, ERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Permit.sol\";\nimport {IERC20Metadata, IERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol\";\nimport {SafeERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport {Math} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\nimport {Address} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol\";\nimport {IERC4626} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC4626.sol\";\nimport {IVault} from \"../interfaces/IVault.sol\";\nimport {IProvider} from \"../interfaces/IProvider.sol\";\nimport {AccessManager} from \"../access/AccessManager.sol\";\nimport {PausableActions} from \"./PausableActions.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title Vault\n */\nabstract contract Vault is ERC20Permit, AccessManager, PausableActions, IVault {\n    using Math for uint256;\n    using Address for address;\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20Metadata;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Errors\n     */\n    error Vault__Unauthorized();\n    error Vault__AddressZero();\n    error Vault__InvalidInput();\n    error Vault__DepositLessThanMin();\n    error Vault__SetupAlreadyCompleted();\n\n    uint256 internal constant PRECISION_FACTOR = 1e18;\n    uint256 internal constant MAX_WITHDRAW_FEE_PERCENT = 0.05 * 1e18; // 5%\n    uint256 internal constant MAX_REBALANCE_FEE_PERCENT = 0.2 * 1e18; // 20%\n\n    IERC20Metadata internal immutable _asset;\n    uint8 private immutable _underlyingDecimals;\n\n    IProvider[] internal _providers;\n    IProvider public activeProvider;\n\n    uint256 public minAmount;\n    uint256 public withdrawFeePercent;\n\n    address public timelock;\n    address public treasury;\n\n    bool public setupCompleted;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts if called by any account other than the timelock contract.\n     */\n    modifier onlyTimelock() {\n        if (msg.sender != timelock) {\n            revert Vault__Unauthorized();\n        }\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initializes the Vault contract with the specified parameters.\n     * @param asset_ The address of the underlying asset managed by the vault.\n     * @param name_ The name of the tokenized vault.\n     * @param symbol_ The symbol of the tokenized vault.\n     * @param providers_ An array of providers serving as a liquidity source for lending and/or yield.\n     * @param withdrawFeePercent_ The fee percentage applied to withdrawals.\n     * @param timelock_ The address of the timelock contract.\n     * @param treasury_ The address of the treasury.\n     */\n    constructor(\n        address asset_,\n        string memory name_,\n        string memory symbol_,\n        IProvider[] memory providers_,\n        uint256 withdrawFeePercent_,\n        address timelock_,\n        address treasury_\n    ) ERC20(name_, symbol_) ERC20Permit(name_) {\n        if (asset_ == address(0)) {\n            revert Vault__AddressZero();\n        }\n\n        _asset = IERC20Metadata(asset_);\n        _underlyingDecimals = IERC20Metadata(asset_).decimals();\n\n        _setTimelock(timelock_);\n        _setProviders(providers_);\n        _setActiveProvider(providers_[0]);\n        _setTreasury(treasury_);\n        _setWithdrawFeePercent(withdrawFeePercent_);\n        _setMinAmount(1e6);\n\n        /// @dev pause deposit and mint actions until vault setup is completed.\n        _pause(Actions.Deposit);\n    }\n\n    /*////////////////////\n      ERC4626 Management\n    ////////////////////*/\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the number of decimals used to get number representation.\n     */\n    function decimals()\n        public\n        view\n        override(IERC20Metadata, ERC20)\n        returns (uint8)\n    {\n        return _underlyingDecimals;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function asset() public view override returns (address) {\n        return address(_asset);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function totalAssets() public view override returns (uint256 assets) {\n        return _getBalanceAtProviders();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function convertToShares(\n        uint256 assets\n    ) public view override returns (uint256 shares) {\n        return _convertToShares(assets, Math.Rounding.Floor);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function convertToAssets(\n        uint256 shares\n    ) public view override returns (uint256 assets) {\n        return _convertToAssets(shares, Math.Rounding.Floor);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function maxDeposit(address) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        if (paused(Actions.Deposit)) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        return type(uint256).max;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function maxMint(address) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        if (paused(Actions.Deposit)) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        return type(uint256).max;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function maxWithdraw(address owner) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        if (paused(Actions.Withdraw)) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        return convertToAssets(balanceOf(owner));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function maxRedeem(address owner) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        if (paused(Actions.Withdraw)) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        return balanceOf(owner);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function previewDeposit(\n        uint256 assets\n    ) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return _convertToShares(assets, Math.Rounding.Floor);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function previewMint(\n        uint256 shares\n    ) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return _convertToAssets(shares, Math.Rounding.Ceil);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function previewWithdraw(\n        uint256 assets\n    ) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return _convertToShares(assets, Math.Rounding.Ceil);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function previewRedeem(\n        uint256 shares\n    ) public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return _convertToAssets(shares, Math.Rounding.Floor);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function deposit(\n        uint256 assets,\n        address receiver\n    ) public override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 shares = previewDeposit(assets);\n\n        _validateDeposit(receiver, assets, shares);\n        _deposit(msg.sender, receiver, assets, shares);\n\n        return shares;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function mint(\n        uint256 shares,\n        address receiver\n    ) public override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 assets = previewMint(shares);\n\n        _validateDeposit(receiver, assets, shares);\n        _deposit(msg.sender, receiver, assets, shares);\n\n        return assets;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function withdraw(\n        uint256 assets,\n        address receiver,\n        address owner\n    ) public override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 shares = previewWithdraw(assets);\n        (uint256 validatedAssets, uint256 validatedShares) = _validateWithdraw(\n            assets,\n            shares,\n            msg.sender,\n            receiver,\n            owner\n        );\n        _withdraw(\n            msg.sender,\n            receiver,\n            owner,\n            validatedAssets,\n            validatedShares\n        );\n        return validatedShares;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC4626\n     */\n    function redeem(\n        uint256 shares,\n        address receiver,\n        address owner\n    ) public override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 assets = previewRedeem(shares);\n        (uint256 validatedAssets, uint256 validatedShares) = _validateWithdraw(\n            assets,\n            shares,\n            msg.sender,\n            receiver,\n            owner\n        );\n        _withdraw(\n            msg.sender,\n            receiver,\n            owner,\n            validatedAssets,\n            validatedShares\n        );\n        return validatedAssets;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts assets to shares equivalent, with support for rounding direction.\n     *\n     * @param assets The amount of assets to convert to shares.\n     * @param rounding The direction of division remainder for conversion.\n     */\n    function _convertToShares(\n        uint256 assets,\n        Math.Rounding rounding\n    ) internal view returns (uint256 shares) {\n        uint256 supply = totalSupply();\n        return\n            (assets == 0 || supply == 0)\n                ? assets\n                : assets.mulDiv(supply, totalAssets(), rounding);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts shares to assets equivalent, with support for rounding direction.\n     *\n     * @param shares The amount of shares to convert to assets.\n     * @param rounding The direction of division remainder for conversion.\n     */\n    function _convertToAssets(\n        uint256 shares,\n        Math.Rounding rounding\n    ) internal view returns (uint256 assets) {\n        uint256 supply = totalSupply();\n        return\n            (supply == 0)\n                ? shares\n                : shares.mulDiv(totalAssets(), supply, rounding);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Runs checks for all deposit or mint actions in this vault.\n     * @param receiver The address receiving the deposit.\n     * @param assets The amount of assets being deposited.\n     * @param shares The amount of shares being minted for the receiver.\n     */\n    function _validateDeposit(\n        address receiver,\n        uint256 assets,\n        uint256 shares\n    ) internal view whenNotPaused(Actions.Deposit) {\n        if (receiver == address(0)) {\n            revert Vault__AddressZero();\n        }\n        if (assets == 0 || shares == 0) {\n            revert Vault__InvalidInput();\n        }\n        if (assets < minAmount) {\n            revert Vault__DepositLessThanMin();\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Executes a deposit at the active provider.\n     * @param caller The address that initiated the deposit.\n     * @param receiver The address to which shares are minted.\n     * @param assets The amount transferred during this deposit.\n     * @param shares The amount minted to receiver.\n     */\n    function _deposit(\n        address caller,\n        address receiver,\n        uint256 assets,\n        uint256 shares\n    ) internal {\n        _asset.safeTransferFrom(caller, address(this), assets);\n        _delegateActionToProvider(assets, \"deposit\", activeProvider);\n        _mint(receiver, shares);\n\n        emit Deposit(caller, receiver, assets, shares);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Runs checks for all withdraw or redeem actions in this vault.\n     * @param assets The amount of assets being withdrawn.\n     * @param shares The amount of shares being burned during this withdrawal.\n     * @param caller The address that initiated the withdrawal.\n     * @param receiver The address to which the assets will be transferred.\n     * @param owner The address whose shares will be burned.\n     */\n    function _validateWithdraw(\n        uint256 assets,\n        uint256 shares,\n        address caller,\n        address receiver,\n        address owner\n    )\n        internal\n        whenNotPaused(Actions.Withdraw)\n        returns (uint256 validatedAssets, uint256 validatedShares)\n    {\n        if (receiver == address(0) || owner == address(0)) {\n            revert Vault__AddressZero();\n        }\n        if (assets == 0 || shares == 0) {\n            revert Vault__InvalidInput();\n        }\n\n        uint256 _maxWithdraw = maxWithdraw(owner);\n        if (assets > _maxWithdraw) {\n            validatedAssets = _maxWithdraw;\n            validatedShares = validatedAssets.mulDiv(shares, assets);\n        } else {\n            validatedAssets = assets;\n            validatedShares = shares;\n        }\n\n        if (caller != owner) {\n            _spendAllowance(owner, caller, validatedShares);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Executes a withdraw at the active provider.\n     * @param caller The address that initiated the withdrawal.\n     * @param receiver The address to which the assets will be transferred.\n     * @param owner The address whose shares will be burned during this withdrawal.\n     * @param assets The amount of assets being withdrawn from the vault.\n     * @param shares The amount of shares being burned during this withdrawal.\n     */\n    function _withdraw(\n        address caller,\n        address receiver,\n        address owner,\n        uint256 assets,\n        uint256 shares\n    ) internal {\n        uint256 withdrawFee = assets.mulDiv(\n            withdrawFeePercent,\n            PRECISION_FACTOR\n        );\n        uint256 assetsToReceiver = assets - withdrawFee;\n\n        _burn(owner, shares);\n        _delegateActionToProvider(assets, \"withdraw\", activeProvider);\n\n        address _treasury = treasury;\n\n        _asset.safeTransfer(_treasury, withdrawFee);\n        _asset.safeTransfer(receiver, assetsToReceiver);\n\n        emit FeeCharged(_treasury, withdrawFee);\n        emit Withdraw(caller, receiver, owner, assetsToReceiver, shares);\n    }\n\n    /*/////////////////////\n      REBALANCE functions\n    /////////////////////*/\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IVault\n     */\n    function setupVault(uint256 assets) external {\n        if (setupCompleted) {\n            revert Vault__SetupAlreadyCompleted();\n        }\n        if (assets < minAmount) {\n            revert Vault__DepositLessThanMin();\n        }\n\n        _unpause(Actions.Deposit);\n\n        _deposit(msg.sender, address(this), assets, assets);\n        setupCompleted = true;\n\n        emit SetupCompleted(msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Pauses the specified action in the vault.\n     *\n     * @param action The action to pause.\n     */\n    function pause(Actions action) external onlyAdmin {\n        _pause(action);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Unpauses the specified action in the vault.\n     *\n     * @param action The action to unpause.\n     */\n    function unpause(Actions action) external onlyAdmin {\n        _unpause(action);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the address of the timelock contract.\n     * @param _timelock The address of the new timelock contract.\n     */\n    function setTimelock(address _timelock) external onlyTimelock {\n        _setTimelock(_timelock);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the list of providers for this vault.\n     * @param providers An array of provider contracts.\n     */\n    function setProviders(IProvider[] memory providers) external onlyTimelock {\n        _setProviders(providers);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the active provider for this vault.\n     * @param _activeProvider The contract of the new active provider.\n     *\n     */\n    function setActiveProvider(IProvider _activeProvider) external onlyAdmin {\n        _setActiveProvider(_activeProvider);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the treasury address for this vault.\n     * @param _treasury The new treasury address.\n     */\n    function setTreasury(address _treasury) external onlyAdmin {\n        _setTreasury(_treasury);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the withdrawal fee percentage for this vault.\n     * @param _withdrawFeePercent The new withdrawal fee percentage.\n     */\n    function setWithdrawFeePercent(\n        uint256 _withdrawFeePercent\n    ) external onlyAdmin {\n        _setWithdrawFeePercent(_withdrawFeePercent);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the minimum amount required for deposit and mint actions.\n     * @param _minAmount The new minimum amount.\n     */\n    function setMinAmount(uint256 _minAmount) external onlyAdmin {\n        _setMinAmount(_minAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to update the address of the timelock contract.\n     * @param _timelock The address of the new timelock contract.\n     */\n    function _setTimelock(address _timelock) internal {\n        if (_timelock == address(0)) {\n            revert Vault__AddressZero();\n        }\n        timelock = _timelock;\n        emit TimelockUpdated(_timelock);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to set the providers for this vault.\n     * @param providers An array of provider contracts.\n     */\n    function _setProviders(IProvider[] memory providers) internal {\n        for (uint256 i; i < providers.length; i++) {\n            if (address(providers[i]) == address(0)) {\n                revert Vault__AddressZero();\n            }\n            _asset.forceApprove(\n                providers[i].getSource(asset(), address(this), address(0)),\n                type(uint256).max\n            );\n        }\n        _providers = providers;\n\n        emit ProvidersUpdated(providers);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to set the active provider for this vault.\n     * @param _activeProvider The contract of the new active provider.\n     */\n    function _setActiveProvider(IProvider _activeProvider) internal {\n        if (!_validateProvider(address(_activeProvider))) {\n            revert Vault__InvalidInput();\n        }\n        activeProvider = _activeProvider;\n        emit ActiveProviderUpdated(_activeProvider);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to set the treasury address for this vault.\n     * @param _treasury The new treasury address.\n     */\n    function _setTreasury(address _treasury) internal {\n        if (_treasury == address(0)) {\n            revert Vault__AddressZero();\n        }\n        treasury = _treasury;\n        emit TreasuryUpdated(_treasury);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to set the withdrawal fee percentage for this vault.\n     * @param _withdrawFeePercent The new withdrawal fee percentage.\n     */\n    function _setWithdrawFeePercent(uint256 _withdrawFeePercent) internal {\n        if (_withdrawFeePercent > MAX_WITHDRAW_FEE_PERCENT) {\n            revert Vault__InvalidInput();\n        }\n        withdrawFeePercent = _withdrawFeePercent;\n        emit WithdrawFeePercentUpdated(_withdrawFeePercent);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to set the minimum amount required for deposit and mint actions.\n     * @param _minAmount The new minimum amount.\n     */\n    function _setMinAmount(uint256 _minAmount) internal {\n        minAmount = _minAmount;\n        emit MinAmountUpdated(_minAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Delegates an action to a provider.\n     * @param assets The amount of assets involved in the action.\n     * @param actionName The identifier of the method to call.\n     * @param provider The provider contract to which the action is delegated.\n     */\n    function _delegateActionToProvider(\n        uint256 assets,\n        string memory actionName,\n        IProvider provider\n    ) internal {\n        bytes memory data = abi.encodeWithSignature(\n            string(abi.encodePacked(actionName, \"(uint256,address)\")),\n            assets,\n            address(this)\n        );\n        address(provider).functionDelegateCall(data);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the total balance of the asset held by this vault across all listed providers.\n     */\n    function _getBalanceAtProviders()\n        internal\n        view\n        returns (uint256 totalBalance)\n    {\n        uint256 providerBalance;\n        uint256 count = _providers.length;\n        for (uint256 i; i < count; i++) {\n            providerBalance = _providers[i].getDepositBalance(\n                address(this),\n                this\n            );\n            totalBalance += providerBalance;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the specified provider is in the list of providers.\n     * @param provider The address of the provider to validate.\n     */\n    function _validateProvider(\n        address provider\n    ) internal view returns (bool valid) {\n        uint256 count = _providers.length;\n        for (uint256 i; i < count; i++) {\n            if (provider == address(_providers[i])) {\n                valid = true;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the amount of assets owned by the specified address.\n     * @param owner The address of the account whose asset balance is checked.\n     */\n    function getBalanceOfAsset(\n        address owner\n    ) public view returns (uint256 assets) {\n        return convertToAssets(balanceOf(owner));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the array of providers of this vault.\n     */\n    function getProviders() public view returns (IProvider[] memory) {\n        return _providers;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x09388354ed3407bc9a9c5ec287cd41d39ec3268f1bc22c933ef129b2ad335751","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IProvider.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.23;\n\nimport {IVault} from \"./IVault.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title IProvider\n */\ninterface IProvider {\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the identifier of the provider.\n     */\n    function getIdentifier() external view returns (string memory);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the source address that requires ERC20 approval for vault actions.\n     *\n     * @param keyOne The first key for identification\n     * @param keyTwo The second key for identification\n     * @param keyThree The third key for identification\n     *\n     * @dev Some provider implementations may not require all keys.\n     */\n    function getSource(\n        address keyOne,\n        address keyTwo,\n        address keyThree\n    ) external view returns (address source);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Performs a deposit at the provider on behalf of a vault.\n     *\n     * @param amount The amount to deposit.\n     * @param vault The vault calling this function.\n     *\n     * @dev This function should be delegate called in the context of a vault.\n     */\n    function deposit(\n        uint256 amount,\n        IVault vault\n    ) external returns (bool success);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Performs a withdraw at the provider on behalf of a vault.\n     *\n     * @param amount The amount to withdraw.\n     * @param vault The vault calling this function.\n     *\n     * @dev This function should be delegate called in the context of a vault.\n     */\n    function withdraw(\n        uint256 amount,\n        IVault vault\n    ) external returns (bool success);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the deposit balance of a user at the provider.\n     *\n     * @param user The address of the user whose balance is needed.\n     * @param vault The vault required by specific providers with multi-markets; otherwise, pass address(0).\n     */\n    function getDepositBalance(\n        address user,\n        IVault vault\n    ) external view returns (uint256 balance);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the latest supply annual percentage rate (APR) at the provider.\n     *\n     * @param vault The vault required by specific provider with multi-markets; otherwise, pass address(0).\n     *\n     * @dev Must return the rate in ray units (1e27).\n     */\n    function getDepositRate(IVault vault) external view returns (uint256 rate);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x2dd17877cce80d0e15354240b452608734b14561b56521c07f56fd890216c54e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IVault.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.8.23;\n\nimport {IERC4626} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC4626.sol\";\nimport {IProvider} from \"./IProvider.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title IVault\n */\ninterface IVault is IERC4626 {\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the vault setup is completed.\n     *\n     * @param setupAddress The address that performed the vault setup.\n     */\n    event SetupCompleted(address indexed setupAddress);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the timelock contract is changed.\n     *\n     * @param timelock The new timelock contract address.\n     */\n    event TimelockUpdated(address indexed timelock);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the available providers for the vault change.\n     *\n     * @param providers The new array of providers.\n     */\n    event ProvidersUpdated(IProvider[] providers);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the active provider is changed.\n     *\n     * @param activeProvider The new active provider.\n     */\n    event ActiveProviderUpdated(IProvider activeProvider);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the treasury address is changed.\n     *\n     * @param treasury The new treasury address.\n     */\n    event TreasuryUpdated(address indexed treasury);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the withdrawal fee percentage is changed.\n     *\n     * @param withdrawFeePercent The new withdrawal fee percentage.\n     */\n    event WithdrawFeePercentUpdated(uint256 withdrawFeePercent);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the minimum amount is changed.\n     *\n     * @param minAmount The new minimum amount.\n     */\n    event MinAmountUpdated(uint256 minAmount);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when a fee is charged.\n     *\n     * @param treasury The treasury address of the vault.\n     * @param fee The amount charged.\n     */\n    event FeeCharged(address indexed treasury, uint256 fee);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the vault is rebalanced.\n     *\n     * @param assetsFrom The amount of assets rebalanced from.\n     * @param assetsTo The amount of assets rebalanced to.\n     * @param from The provider from which assets are rebalanced.\n     * @param to The provider to which assets are rebalanced.\n     */\n    event RebalanceExecuted(\n        uint256 assetsFrom,\n        uint256 assetsTo,\n        address indexed from,\n        address indexed to\n    );\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets up the vault with a specified amount of assets to prevent inflation attacks.\n     * @dev Refer to: https://rokinot.github.io/hatsfinance\n     *\n     * @param assets The amount used to set up the vault.\n     */\n    function setupVault(uint256 assets) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Performs rebalancing of the vault by moving funds across providers.\n     * @param assets The amount of assets to be rebalanced.\n     * @param from The provider currently holding the assets.\n     * @param to The provider receiving the assets.\n     * @param fee The fee amount charged for the rebalancing.\n     * @param activateToProvider A flag indicating whether to mark the receiving provider as active.\n     */\n    function rebalance(\n        uint256 assets,\n        IProvider from,\n        IProvider to,\n        uint256 fee,\n        bool activateToProvider\n    ) external returns (bool);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x8e4ee06699b079a4c3cf5b86d747ab837b7f45a22e2be9305626a7baba83c977","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.custom:rebalancing-features: The contract provides: - Automated provider-to-provider transfers - Configurable rebalancing fees (max 20%) - Active provider management - Fee collection to treasury - Comprehensive event logging
devdoc.custom:rebalancing-process: The rebalancing workflow: 1. Validate source and destination providers 2. Check fee limits (max 20% of rebalanced amount) 3. Withdraw assets from source provider 4. Deposit assets to destination provider (minus fee) 5. Transfer fee to treasury 6. Optionally activate destination provider 7. Emit rebalancing events
devdoc.custom:security-measures: Security features include: - Operator-only rebalancing execution - Provider validation before operations - Fee limits to prevent excessive charges - Proper asset accounting and transfers - Event emission for transparency
devdoc.custom:usage: Example: ```solidity // Rebalance 1000 USDC from Aave to Morpho with 1% fee rebalancer.rebalance(     1000e6, // 1000 USDC     aaveProvider,     morphoProvider,     10e6, // 1% fee (10 USDC)     true // Activate Morpho as active provider ); ```
devdoc.details: This contract extends the base Vault functionality with automated rebalancing      capabilities, allowing operators to move funds between providers efficiently      while maintaining proper fee structures and security controls.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

InvalidAccountNonce(address,uint256).details: The nonce used for an `account` is not the expected current nonce.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

params.treasury: The treasury address of the vault.

Paused(address,uint8).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account` for a specific `action`.

params.assetsFrom: The amount of assets rebalanced from.
params.assetsTo: The amount of assets rebalanced to.
params.from: The provider from which assets are rebalanced.
params.to: The provider to which assets are rebalanced.

params.setupAddress: The address that performed the vault setup.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Unpaused(address,uint8).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account` for a specific `action`.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

asset().details: Returns the address of the underlying token used for the Vault for accounting, depositing, and withdrawing. - MUST be an ERC-20 token contract. - MUST NOT revert.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

constructor.details: Initializes the Rebalancer contract with the specified parameters.

params.asset_: The address of the underlying asset managed by the vault.
params.name_: The name of the tokenized vault.
params.providers_: An array of providers serving as a liquidity source for lending and/or yield.
params.symbol_: The symbol of the tokenized vault.
params.timelock_: The address of the timelock contract.
params.withdrawFeePercent_: The fee percentage applied to withdrawals.

convertToAssets(uint256).details: Returns the amount of assets that the Vault would exchange for the amount of shares provided, in an ideal scenario where all the conditions are met. - MUST NOT be inclusive of any fees that are charged against assets in the Vault. - MUST NOT show any variations depending on the caller. - MUST NOT reflect slippage or other on-chain conditions, when performing the actual exchange. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: This calculation MAY NOT reflect the per-user price-per-share, and instead should reflect the average-users price-per-share, meaning what the average user should expect to see when exchanging to and from.

convertToShares(uint256).details: Returns the amount of shares that the Vault would exchange for the amount of assets provided, in an ideal scenario where all the conditions are met. - MUST NOT be inclusive of any fees that are charged against assets in the Vault. - MUST NOT show any variations depending on the caller. - MUST NOT reflect slippage or other on-chain conditions, when performing the actual exchange. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: This calculation MAY NOT reflect the per-user price-per-share, and instead should reflect the average-users price-per-share, meaning what the average user should expect to see when exchanging to and from.

deposit(uint256,address).details: Mints shares Vault shares to receiver by depositing exactly amount of underlying tokens. - MUST emit the Deposit event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the   deposit execution, and are accounted for during deposit. - MUST revert if all of assets cannot be deposited (due to deposit limit being reached, slippage, the user not   approving enough underlying tokens to the Vault contract, etc). NOTE: most implementations will require pre-approval of the Vault with the Vaults underlying asset token.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

params.owner: The address of the account whose asset balance is checked.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have the admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

maxDeposit(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of the underlying asset that can be deposited into the Vault for the receiver, through a deposit call. - MUST return a limited value if receiver is subject to some deposit limit. - MUST return 2 ** 256 - 1 if there is no limit on the maximum amount of assets that may be deposited. - MUST NOT revert.

maxMint(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of the Vault shares that can be minted for the receiver, through a mint call. - MUST return a limited value if receiver is subject to some mint limit. - MUST return 2 ** 256 - 1 if there is no limit on the maximum amount of shares that may be minted. - MUST NOT revert.

maxRedeem(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of Vault shares that can be redeemed from the owner balance in the Vault, through a redeem call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST return balanceOf(owner) if owner is not subject to any withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert.

maxWithdraw(address).details: Returns the maximum amount of the underlying asset that can be withdrawn from the owner balance in the Vault, through a withdraw call. - MUST return a limited value if owner is subject to some withdrawal limit or timelock. - MUST NOT revert.

mint(uint256,address).details: Mints exactly shares Vault shares to receiver by depositing amount of underlying tokens. - MUST emit the Deposit event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the mint   execution, and are accounted for during mint. - MUST revert if all of shares cannot be minted (due to deposit limit being reached, slippage, the user not   approving enough underlying tokens to the Vault contract, etc). NOTE: most implementations will require pre-approval of the Vault with the Vaults underlying asset token.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Returns the current nonce for `owner`. This value must be included whenever a signature is generated for {permit}. Every successful call to {permit} increases ``owner``'s nonce by one. This prevents a signature from being used multiple times.

paused(uint8).details: Returns true if the specified `action` is paused, and false otherwise.

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

previewDeposit(uint256).details: Allows an on-chain or off-chain user to simulate the effects of their deposit at the current block, given current on-chain conditions. - MUST return as close to and no more than the exact amount of Vault shares that would be minted in a deposit   call in the same transaction. I.e. deposit should return the same or more shares as previewDeposit if called   in the same transaction. - MUST NOT account for deposit limits like those returned from maxDeposit and should always act as though the   deposit would be accepted, regardless if the user has enough tokens approved, etc. - MUST be inclusive of deposit fees. Integrators should be aware of the existence of deposit fees. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: any unfavorable discrepancy between convertToShares and previewDeposit SHOULD be considered slippage in share price or some other type of condition, meaning the depositor will lose assets by depositing.

previewMint(uint256).details: Allows an on-chain or off-chain user to simulate the effects of their mint at the current block, given current on-chain conditions. - MUST return as close to and no fewer than the exact amount of assets that would be deposited in a mint call   in the same transaction. I.e. mint should return the same or fewer assets as previewMint if called in the   same transaction. - MUST NOT account for mint limits like those returned from maxMint and should always act as though the mint   would be accepted, regardless if the user has enough tokens approved, etc. - MUST be inclusive of deposit fees. Integrators should be aware of the existence of deposit fees. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: any unfavorable discrepancy between convertToAssets and previewMint SHOULD be considered slippage in share price or some other type of condition, meaning the depositor will lose assets by minting.

previewRedeem(uint256).details: Allows an on-chain or off-chain user to simulate the effects of their redemption at the current block, given current on-chain conditions. - MUST return as close to and no more than the exact amount of assets that would be withdrawn in a redeem call   in the same transaction. I.e. redeem should return the same or more assets as previewRedeem if called in the   same transaction. - MUST NOT account for redemption limits like those returned from maxRedeem and should always act as though the   redemption would be accepted, regardless if the user has enough shares, etc. - MUST be inclusive of withdrawal fees. Integrators should be aware of the existence of withdrawal fees. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: any unfavorable discrepancy between convertToAssets and previewRedeem SHOULD be considered slippage in share price or some other type of condition, meaning the depositor will lose assets by redeeming.

previewWithdraw(uint256).details: Allows an on-chain or off-chain user to simulate the effects of their withdrawal at the current block, given current on-chain conditions. - MUST return as close to and no fewer than the exact amount of Vault shares that would be burned in a withdraw   call in the same transaction. I.e. withdraw should return the same or fewer shares as previewWithdraw if   called   in the same transaction. - MUST NOT account for withdrawal limits like those returned from maxWithdraw and should always act as though   the withdrawal would be accepted, regardless if the user has enough shares, etc. - MUST be inclusive of withdrawal fees. Integrators should be aware of the existence of withdrawal fees. - MUST NOT revert. NOTE: any unfavorable discrepancy between convertToShares and previewWithdraw SHOULD be considered slippage in share price or some other type of condition, meaning the depositor will lose assets by depositing.

params.activateToProvider: A flag indicating whether to mark the receiving provider as active.
params.assets: The amount of assets to be rebalanced.
params.fee: The fee amount charged for the rebalancing.
params.from: The provider currently holding the assets.

redeem(uint256,address,address).details: Burns exactly shares from owner and sends assets of underlying tokens to receiver. - MUST emit the Withdraw event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the   redeem execution, and are accounted for during redeem. - MUST revert if all of shares cannot be redeemed (due to withdrawal limit being reached, slippage, the owner   not having enough shares, etc). NOTE: some implementations will require pre-requesting to the Vault before a withdrawal may be performed. Those methods should be performed separately.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have the admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._activeProvider: The contract of the new active provider.

params._timelock: The address of the new timelock contract.

params.assets: The amount used to set up the vault.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalAssets().details: Returns the total amount of the underlying asset that is managed by Vault. - SHOULD include any compounding that occurs from yield. - MUST be inclusive of any fees that are charged against assets in the Vault. - MUST NOT revert.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

withdraw(uint256,address,address).details: Burns shares from owner and sends exactly assets of underlying tokens to receiver. - MUST emit the Withdraw event. - MAY support an additional flow in which the underlying tokens are owned by the Vault contract before the   withdraw execution, and are accounted for during withdraw. - MUST revert if all of assets cannot be withdrawn (due to withdrawal limit being reached, slippage, the owner   not having enough shares, etc). Note that some implementations will require pre-requesting to the Vault before a withdrawal may be performed. Those methods should be performed separately.

rebalance(uint256,address,address,uint25.notice: Performs rebalancing of the vault by moving funds across providers.
